definition: time is gold/every minute counts
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: B: It’s quite obvious that every minute counts.
Every cut of ancient epigraph of this kind is precious.
sentences.chinese: 这种古代金石铭文，一刻千金。

definition: a single day apart seems like three seasons (idiom)
a very brief period of time (lit. the time it takes for a shadow to move an inch)
Time that has passed will never come back. (idiom)
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom)/(in praise of a piece of writing or calligraphy) each character is perfect/each word is highly valued
fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
to cherish every moment/to make good use of one's time
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
lit. amidst the flowers under the moonlight (idiom)/fig. romantic surroundings
(literary) (of time) to slip away
can be compared to/is the same as
to amuse/to divert/happy/joyful/pleasure/amusement
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
fine evening, beautiful scenery (idiom)
lit. to trade a fur coat for wine (idiom)/fig. (of wealthy people) to lead a dissolute and extravagant life
